parameters: Odan, now that we've got a minute, what's the
You know that my parents didn't always treat
me well. Well, what you didn't know, was that
before we came to Castle Altair, they used
to be worshippers at this shrine.
Was Selvaris the High priest back then?
Not yet, but he was climbing the ranks. My
parents were easily led, and they bought into
his fanaticism. They'd punish me harshly for
minor things, all in the name of serving their
gods. One day, he actually demanded that they
offer me as a sacrifice to them.
That was the day my parents finally pushed
back, and said enough. I thought that finally,
it would be over, and that they would start
Fanatics. They are the cause of so many
Are there no gods in Kheltari?
We killed our gods centuries ago. They were
much more trouble than they were worth.
I won't say that faith has no place, but there
is much truth in what you say Feylora.
What happened when you all moved to Castle
You know the story Elim. They continued to
treat me badly. I suspect this time rather than
fear and guilt from Selvaris, more from anger
and resentment at being cast out.
I'm so sorry that you had to go through that...
Don't be Tali! Look at how his hatred has made
Ahhh Odan. You know, you really were a special
boy. So full of passion and energy. It's still
not too late for you to join the winning side.
What the hell are you talking about?
I'm truly impressed that you defeated my
servant. Conjuring a Violet Dragon takes a
You sent the dragon after us? Why!?!
Well, my master Sargon leaves the details of
"how" I carry out my orders to my discretion.
Suffice it to say, we know about the shards
that you carry, and that you aim to take the
one that's here. We have tried to retrieve it
from the temple depths, but a strange energy
field has been preventing us from accessing it.
I suspect that your pathetic little band of
"heroes", wouldn't have come here without the
means to obtain it. Means, which I fully intend
to take from you. You will remain here, while
I summon my master's forces to come and
You won't get away with this Selvaris!
Foolish boy. Enjoy the comforts of the chamber,
Damn him! What are we going to to?
There has to be a way out of here, we'll find
He went into the tunnel up there - maybe there
is a way to get up there, or lower the
This gate is barring the way out!

much more trouble than they were worth.
I won't say that faith has no place, but there
is much truth in what you say Feylora.

You know the story Elim. They continued to
treat me badly. I suspect this time rather than
fear and guilt from Selvaris, more from anger
and resentment at being cast out.
I'm so sorry that you had to go through that...

Ahhh Odan. You know, you really were a special
boy. So full of passion and energy. It's still
not too late for you to join the winning side.

I'm truly impressed that you defeated my

You sent the dragon after us? Why!?!
Well, my master Sargon leaves the details of
"how" I carry out my orders to my discretion.
Suffice it to say, we know about the shards
that you carry, and that you aim to take the
one that's here. We have tried to retrieve it
from the temple depths, but a strange energy
field has been preventing us from accessing it.
I suspect that your pathetic little band of
"heroes", wouldn't have come here without the
means to obtain it. Means, which I fully intend
to take from you. You will remain here, while
I summon my master's forces to come and

You know that my parents didn't always treat
me well. Well, what you didn't know, was that
before we came to Castle Altair, they used
to be worshippers at this shrine.
Was Selvaris the High priest back then?
Not yet, but he was climbing the ranks. My
parents were easily led, and they bought into
his fanaticism. They'd punish me harshly for
minor things, all in the name of serving their
gods. One day, he actually demanded that they
offer me as a sacrifice to them.
That was the day my parents finally pushed
back, and said enough. I thought that finally,
it would be over, and that they would start
Fanatics. They are the cause of so many
